Text.Value: Oh no! Whatever shall we do?

EditorData.NodeContext: amused, ironic, making fun of the player.
EditorData.SFXTags: loud (but small) bird and squirrel angrily chirping
EditorData.StateChangeTags: Bird and Squirrel now face the Player. They both leave the scene.

EditorData.NodeContext: amused, ironic, making fun of the player.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The camera starts on the bard, then pans to the animals.
EditorData.InternalNodeContext: We should be able to hear the bards song in the background, overshadowed be the animals complaining.
EditorData.NodeContext: The animals are listening to someone sing and play the lute. They hate the sound and are uncomfortable.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: Bird and Squirrel face the Bard
Bird and squirrel face the Bard

EditorData.NodeContext: throwing shade at the bard, snickering

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Squirrel] covering it's ears feeling more uncomfortable (level2) (WilsonLee)

Text.Value: Of course - we are born performers.

EditorData.SFXTags: bird and squirrel chittering in amusement, High-pitch insult (in Birds and Squirrel)
EditorData.StateChangeTags: Bird and squirrel leave the scene

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Squirrel] covering it's ears feeling more uncomfortable (level2) (WilsonLee)

Text.Value: Sing along with them, improvising lyrics: 'How can we stop this dreadful song, this half-formed verse from leaden tongue?'
Sing along with them, improvising lyrics: 'How can we stop this dreadful song, half-formed verse from devil's tongue?'
Bravo. You could go on tour, with talent like that.
With my last strength, I will save us both! Away. Away.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Squirrel] cover it's ears, feeling uncomfortable then hop away(WilsonLee)
[Squirrel] screeching angrily while covering it's ears(WilsonLee)

Text.Value: Shut up - I want to hear the bard.
It is quite a racket. You could just spare your ears by leaving.
My head is melting! I'm leaving before the damage is permanent.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Squirrel] cover it's ears then hop away (WilsonLee)
EditorData.NodeContext: amused, ironic, making fun of the player.

EditorData.StateChangeTags: Bird and squerrel face the Bard

Text.Value: We can't! Our brains are melting!

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Squirrel] covering it's ears feeling more uncomfortable (level2) (WilsonLee)

Text.Value: Sing along with the bard - as loudly and off-key as you can.
Don't mock her - she's trying her best... I assume.
*The critters start a duet of their own, attempting to drown out the bard's music. They look at you expectantly.*

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Squirrels] sings and dance then look at [Player] (WilsonLee)
EditorData.NodeContext: watching a bird and a squirrel sing together
EditorData.SFXTags: bird chirping a song, squirrel chirruping along with it

Text.Value: Finally, a song to set our heads straight after that display. We should leave, before the effect wears off.

EditorData.StateChangeTags: Bird and Squirrel face the Bard

EditorData.NodeContext: The animals are listening to someone sing and play the lute. They hate the sound and are uncomfortable.

Text.Value: Sing for them, improvising lyrics: 'How can we stop this dreadful song, this half-formed verse from leaden tongue?'
Sing for them, improvising lyrics: 'How can we stop this dreadful song, half-formed verse from devil's tongue?'
Corinna, drag me away! The big one is right - we should go, before it's too late.

Synopsis: This occurs as the bard, Alfira is playing her lute. The animals are NOT impressed and making fun of her and the player. They are very dramatic.
